remarks: Sylow's third theorem.  The number of Sylow subgroups is a divisor of ` | G | / d ` , where ` d ` is the common order of a Sylow subgroup, and is equivalent to ` 1 mod P ` .  This is part of Metamath 100 proof #72. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 19-Jan-2015.)
statement:
sylow3.x $e |- X = ( Base ` G ) $.
sylow3.g $e |- ( ph -> G e. Grp ) $.
sylow3.xf $e |- ( ph -> X e. Fin ) $.
sylow3.p $e |- ( ph -> P e. Prime ) $.
sylow3.n $e |- N = ( # ` ( P pSyl G ) ) $.
sylow3 $p |- ( ph -> ( N || ( ( # ` X ) / ( P ^ ( P pCnt ( # ` X ) ) ) ) /\ ( N mod P ) = 1 ) ) $.
